posts.post_content: A 6/6 with trample for 6 is great *without* the landfall. It seems overpowered.

Posted By: TheFoilFencer (9/25/2009 3:00:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm beginning to think that the mythic rare symbol on a card can simply be read as "This card is overpowered" in most instances. Because I'm biased, I like this over [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) or [Ob Nixilis, the Fallen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ob Nixilis, the Fallen), but that's really because this is green and those aren't. This might be overpowered, but it seems like all the colors are just poised to get their own game-altering creatures. Red and blue are next, if the trend continues.
posts.html:

Because I'm biased, I like this over Baneslayer Angel or Ob Nixilis, the Fallen, but that's really because this is green and those aren't. Posted By: Zulp (9/25/2009 5:42:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It is not overpowered.  
But i also agree that Mythic Rares tend to get a unnecessarily high powerlevel nonetheless.  
  
As mentioned before a 6/6 trampler for 6 mana is already useful by itself (although of course not worth the Mythic rare slot), yet such a card with an incredibly mana/power relation should not also get one of the most insane Landfall triggers you could think of - getting *4/4* fatties just by playing lands without being required to pay *any mana* or something similar seems ridiculously powerful.  
Other token generating cards will require mana for each token and do not have such a great body at the same time.  
Making the baloths 4/4 instead would still have easily kept this card being worth a Mythic rare, even without trample.  
Or they could also have been triple-costed - which should at least have been the case with [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) as well, in my opinion.
posts.html:
It is not overpowered.
But i also agree that Mythic Rares tend to get a unnecessarily high powerlevel nonetheless.

As mentioned before a 6/6 trampler for 6 mana is already useful by itself (although of course not worth the Mythic rare slot), yet such a card with an incredibly mana/power relation should not also get one of the most insane Landfall triggers you could think of - getting 4/4 fatties just by playing lands without being required to pay any mana or something similar seems ridiculously powerful.
Other token generating cards will require mana for each token and do not have such a great body at the same time.
Making the baloths 4/4 instead would still have easily kept this card being worth a Mythic rare, even without trample.
Or they could also have been triple-costed - which should at least have been the case with Baneslayer Angel as well, in my opinion.

posts.post_content:
I <3 this card, yay green, I get an awesome creature who can make 4/4 tokens for me. I'm a fan of token swarm creation, and big creatures, and the baloth has both! Add in a beastmasters ascension, and you got yourself some new scary 9/9 baloth tokens.
  
   
Update: Found my old sakura tribe scout cards, play an extra land a turn, get 2, 4/4 tokens, and destroy enemy. Plus, because sakura tribe scout lets you play another land a turn, you can ramp up enough land to play the baloth by as early as turn 3.

posts.post_content:
WOOOOOOOOT!!! [Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baloth)s are back!
  
   
Today is the greatest day of my life! My friend gave me the promo Rampaging Baloth!! I can die happy now! (I bet you're all thinking about how pathetic my life is! :P)
  
   
I like how they're bringing back 4/4 beasts, like in [Beast Attack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Beast Attack). (Versus the 3/3 beasts [Garruk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk) makes.
  
   
I think they're trying to ensure beasts as the powerhouse of green, especially with [Terra Stomper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terra Stomper). (Versus angels, krakens, demons and dragons) But you can never be sure.
